`+ rTensor_exact`

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9806021875/job/27076900377)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9806021875/job/27076899982)
We could reuse the proof in `lTensor_exact`, but I think it is faster to just copy and paste
We have `Injective.comp_exact_iff_exact`. Do you need the non-linearMap version?
Not really, but somebody might do. I am not sure if I should delete it
I think we can keep it.
I find it strange that these universe constraints exists. I thought the main purpose of the nonstandard definitions is to avoid these.

This universe constraint is harder to avoid, it comes from Baer's criterion where we need to lift every ideal to a module. So if module lives in a universe that is smaller than the ring, Baer's criterion might not be true. @alreadydone has thought a lot about this.
I think the only explicit variables should be `exact` and `M`. Same in `rTensor_exact`.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(RingTheory/Flat/Basic): a module is flat iff tensoring is left exact (non-categorical formulation)
